intro: Nemophila modesta, commonly known as the common fairybells, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, depending on the variety. Nemophila modesta thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, often found in woodland and grassland habitats. It is a popular choice for native gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
